summary:
As an experimental plasma physicist my passion is fundamental research in the field of gas discharges as well as development of their technological applications. I am specially driven towards laboratory work and data analysis. I like taking control of all the aspects from the setup design, construction, operation and maintenance. I find specially rewarding, and also critical for success, to achieve a complete understanding of every element that forms an experiment, from the system under study to the equipment used to monitor and control it. Although I am an experimentalist I have a solid theoretical background on plasma and general physics and I am able to formulate equations to explain and understand the experimental data. 

I am self-motivated, pro-active and able to perform my research in an independent way. This being said, I rather work in a team in cooperation with other researchers. My education as a physicist allows me to work with people of different technical and scientific backgrounds. According to my experience cooperation and cross-field work is the key to quality research.

Beyond fundamental research I have interests in technical and non-technical areas such as development, testing, management, business planning and demonstration among others. My ambition now is to work in an environment where I can use my technical skills, but more importantly where I can expand them and learn new ones out of the technical field

courses.name: Teaching and Learning in Higher Education

profile_positions.description:
•	Product Owner for Industrial Analytics Applications 
Develop and deliver data driven and machine learning applications that predict parts and system performance, and reduce the overall factory cycle time

•	Product Owner for Failure Prediction Solutions 
Develop and deliver cloud based machine learning solutions that provide parts failure predictions, increasing system availability at customer 

•	Product Owner for Big Data Streaming Platform 
Develop, and deliver to customer, a cloud and edge computing platform for Big Data Streaming analytics and Machine Learning testing

company.name: Dutch Institute for Fundamental Energy Research (DIFFER)

profile_positions.company: Dutch Institute for Fundamental Energy Research (DIFFER)
profile_positions.description:
-Project title: “Efficient plasma-assisted fuel conversion through control of vibrational excitation”
-Fundamental study, optimization and improvement of the CO2 dissociation process for solar fuels production by means of CO2 discharges. 
-Designing, setting up and executing new experiments with a FEL (Free Electron Laser in FELIX facility, Nijmegen) for an in-depth study of the CO2 vibrational excitation.
-Managing the cooperation between the project partners.
-Co-supervising and managing the Ph.D students within the project
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
-Project title (2012-2015): “Better Upscaling and Optimization of Nanoparticle and Nanostructure Production by Means of Electrical Discharges” 
-Study, improvement and upscale of metal nanoparticles production by means of electric discharges for industrial application. 21 universities, research institutes, industries and end-users participate in the Project.
-Setting the project objectives, agenda, and cooperation with partners as well as implementing the needs of the end-users in our work. 
-Management of the project administration, finances, purchases and the reporting duties.
-Designing and executing the experimental work.
-Design of tools for controlling and monitoring the process in the real industrial scenario

-Project title (2010-2012): “Guiding the self-organization of high-tech plasmas; Modeling, experiments and in-depth monitoring of magnetized plasmas”.
-Fundamental study by both experiments and modeling of low pressure coaxial microwave discharges for solar cell deposition.
-Building a new laser Thomson scattering setup for lower detection limit. 
-Implementing a time resolved Laser Induced Fluorescent setup for plasma kinetics study.
-Responsible for maintenance and organization of high power laser laboratory
-Co-supervising and managing a team of two Ph.D students.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral fellow

profile_positions.description:
-Project title: “Spectroscopic diagnostic of microwave induced plasmas”.
-Fundamental and experimental study of low and high pressure microwave plasmas.
-Study of passive emission spectroscopy diagnostics methods.
-Development of laser Thomson scattering technique for low temperature plasmas
profile_positions.title: PHD Student
